Constructor for QgsProjectionSelectionTreeWidget.
Returns the CRS currently selected in the widget.
Returns true if the current selection in the widget is a valid choice.

detaileddescription.para: Valid selections include any projection and also the "no/invalid projection" option (if setShowNoProjection() was called). Invalid selections are the group headers (such as "Geographic Coordinate Systems"

briefdescription.para: Sets whether to show the bounnds preview map.
Sets whether a "no/invalid" projection option should be shown.

detaileddescription.para:
If this option is selected, calling crs() will return an invalid QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem.
showNoProjection()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the bounds preview map is shown.
Returns whether the "no/invalid" projection option is shown.

detaileddescription.para:
If this option is selected, calling crs() will return an invalid QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem.
setShowNoProjection()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: The initial "preview" rectangle for the bounds overview map.
Marks the current selected projection for push to front of recent projections list.
Sets the initial crs to show within the dialog.
filters this widget by the given CRSs

detaileddescription.para: Sets this widget to filter the available projections to those listed by the given Coordinate Reference Systems.

parameterdescription.para: a list of OGC Coordinate Reference Systems to filter the list of projections by. This is useful in (e.g.) WMS situations where you just want to offer what the WMS server can support.

simplesect.para: This function's behavior is undefined if it is called after the widget is shown.

briefdescription.para: Sets the initial "preview" rectangle for the bounds overview map.
Emitted when a projection is selected in the widget.
Notifies others that the widget is now fully initialized, including deferred selection of projection.
Emitted when a projection is double clicked in the list.
does the legwork of applying CRS Selection

simplesect.para: This function does nothing unless getUserList() and getUserProjList() Have already been called
This function only expands the parents of the selection and does not scroll the list to the selection if the widget is not visible. Therefore you will typically want to use this in a showEvent().

briefdescription.para: Utility method used in conjunction with name based searching tool.
gets an arbitrary sqlite3 expression from the selection
Hide deprecated CRSes.
add recently used CRS
Populate the proj tree view with system projection names...

parameterdescription.para: a list of OGC Coordinate Reference Systems to filter the list of projections by. This is useful in (e.g.) WMS situations where you just want to offer what the WMS server can support.

briefdescription.para: Populate the proj tree view with user defined projection names...

parameterdescription.para: a list of OGC Coordinate Reference Systems to filter the list of projections by. This is useful in (e.g.) WMS situations where you just want to offer what the WMS server can support.

briefdescription.para: converts the CRS group to a SQL expression fragment

detaileddescription.para: Converts the given Coordinate Reference Systems to a format suitable for use in SQL for querying against the QGIS CRS database.

parameterdescription.para: a list of OGC Coordinate Reference Systems to filter the list of projections by. This is useful in (e.g.) WMS situations where you just want to offer what the WMS server can support.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current QGIS projection identfier.
Show the user a warning if the srs database could not be found.
Makes a string safe for use in SQL statements.

detaileddescription.para:
This involves escaping single quotes, double quotes, backslashes, and optionally, percentage symbols. Percentage symbols are used as wildcards sometimes and so when using the string as part of the LIKE phrase of a select statement, should be escaped.
The string made safe for SQL statements.

briefdescription.para: Apply projection on double-click.
Gets list of authorities.
A widget for selecting a coordinate reference system from a tree.

detaileddescription.para: This widget implements a tree view of projections, as seen in the QgsProjectionSelectionDialog dialog. In most cases it is more suitable to use the compact QgsProjectionSelectionWidget widget.
